Issues.Title: docs: Fix small bugs and typos
Issues.Body:
Explanation for the changes:

1.`aio/content/examples/animations/src/app/animations.ts`
`aio/content/examples/animations/src/app/insert-remove.component.ts`
Animation duration is too short to see the opacity related changes. Increased the duration.
2. `aio/content/examples/animations/src/app/status-slider.component.ts`
They forgot to do the accessibility related change on line 35. Also `#754600` is `saddlebrown`, so used it to match other values.
3. `aio/content/examples/dependency-injection/src/app/injector.component.ts`
The video is no longer available.
4. `aio/content/examples/form-validation/src/app/reactive/hero-form-reactive.component.html`
`aio/content/examples/form-validation/src/app/template/hero-form-template.component.html`
The definition for the class`alert-danger` has not been provided anywhere in the example. Also, the compiler omits it from the output.
The documentation mentions of using `{{name.errors?.['forbiddenName'].value}}` in the output, but `Bob` is hard coded in the template instead.
5. `aio/content/examples/http/src/app/http-interceptors/caching-interceptor.ts`
Removed unused import.
6. `aio/content/guide/change-detection-skipping-subtrees.md`
As per the statement in `## Common change detection scenarios` following sections need to be subsections.
7. `aio/content/guide/event-binding-concepts.md`
The text doesn't match the sample code above.
8. `aio/content/guide/i18n-common-prepare.md`
We don't have to create a list for single point and repeat same explanation again.
9. `aio/content/guide/image-directive.md`
Avoid creating actual links for the demo urls.
10. `aio/content/guide/router-tutorial.md`
The explanation doesn't match sample code below. The route  `/crisis-center` comes into picture later in the tutorial.
11. `aio/content/guide/testing-utility-apis.md`
The table is broken due to these mysterious anchors. Also, the anchors haven't been used anywhere in the docs.
12. `aio/content/navigation.json`
Putting "Next Steps" at the end of the navigation list.

***

Issues.Title: feat(testing): Provide MockPlatformLocation by default in BrowserTest…
Issues.Body:
…ingModule

Tests sometimes do not mock out the `PlatformLocation` and end up affecting real browser state. This can mean changing the real URL of the browser during a test, updating the History state object, or any number of other stateful operations. This can result in a test unintentionally affecting other tests in the suite because the browser state does not usually get reset before the next test runs. Providing `MockPlatformLocation` by default prevents these types of accidental test leakages.

In addition, not providing `MockPlatformLocation` by default led to developers needing to add `RouterTestingModule` to their test suite to avoid the problems above. This module has spy `Location` providers which prevent those issues. This commit now makes `RouterTestingModule` obsolete. Developers can now just use `RouterModule.forRoot` or `provideRouter` directly in tests _without_ needing to learn to import additional test providers or modules.

With this, we should consider deprecating `RouterTestingModule` altogether and migrating developers to `RouterModule.forRoot` or `provideRouter` instead. There are some small differences between `SpyLocation` and `MockPlatformLocation` that might cause tests to fail after the migration (`MockPlatformLocation` is actually more correct in its behaviors). If this happens, we can advise developers to also add `provideLocationMocks()` to their test providers, which would re-provide the `SpyLocation` like before and should make the tests pass again.

BREAKING CHANGE: `MockPlatformLocation` is now provided by default in tests. Existing tests may have behaviors which rely on
`BrowserPlatformLocation` instead. For example, direct access to the `window.history` in either the test or the component rather than going through the Angular APIs (`Location.getState()`). The quickest fix is to update the providers in the test suite to override the provider again `TestBed.configureTestingModule({providers: [{provide: PlatformLocation, useClass: BrowserPlatformLocation}]})`. The ideal fix would be to update the code to instead be compatible with `MockPlatformLocation` instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(testing): Provide MockPlatformLocation by default in BrowserTest…" (#49137)

Issues.Title: Element.scrollTo() with smooth behavior in unit test doesn't trigger re-rendering
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When unit testing (currently using Karma, Jasmine and Chrome), if I do this:

```
debugElement.nativeElement.scrollTo(0, 50);
expect(debugElement.nativeElement.scrollTop).toBe(50);
```
but if I do this:

```
debugElement.nativeElement.scrollTo({
  behavior: 'smooth',
  top: 50,
});
expect(debugElement.nativeElement.scrollTop).toBe(50);
```
It always fails.
From what I can tell, no amount of tick(), flush(), fixture.detectChanges(), fixture.detectChanges(), fixture.whenRenderingDone(), applicationRef.tick(), awaiting timeouts, etc. seems to make any difference.

The code
```
elementRef.nativeElement.scrollTo({
  behavior: 'smooth',
  top: 50,
});
```
works fine in the Angular application itself, it just doesn't work in testing.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-smqsny?file=src/scrollto.spec.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

No exceptions, however the scrollTop property does not update when it should.

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.1.6
Node: 16.14.0
Package Manager: npm 8.3.1
OS: win32 x64

Package                                   Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1501.6 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/core    15.1.6 (cli-only)
@angular-devkit/schematics    15.1.6 (cli-only)
@schematics/angular    15.1.6 (cli-only)
jasmine-core:    4.5.0
karma:    6.4.1
karma-chrome-launcher:    3.1.1
karma-coverage:    2.2.0
karma-jasmine:    5.1.0
karma-jasmine-html-reporter:    2.0.0
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Element.scrollTo() with smooth behavior in unit test doesn't trigger re-rendering" (#49124)

Issues.Title: router: `The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure` warning improvements
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

#47988 introduced a warning in dev when the ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure

This ends up generating quite a lot of noise when updating existing tests as the warning is outputted several times per test.

For example, consider this small repro https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-1bky4j?file=repro/src/app/home/home.component.spec.ts (run `ng test`)

The template has just a `routerLink`, and the test provides a "fake" ActivatedRoute (usually with params, but the point is that it's partial and thus incomplete).

This ends up generating:

```
✔ Browser application bundle generation complete.
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 2 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.03 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 2 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.03 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 3 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.045 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 3 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.045 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 4 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.05 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in tests.'
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 4 of 5 SUCCESS (0 secs / 0.05 secs)
WARN: 'The ActivatedRoute has an invalid structure. This is likely due to an incomplete mock in 
Firefox 109.0 (Mac OS 10.15): Executed 5 of 5 SUCCESS (0.086 secs / 0.054 secs)
```

A few questions:
- is the warning really necessary in that case? It's hard to understand (from the warning alone, and even after looking at #47988) in what way this is an issue
- if the warning is necessary and something needs to be fixed for an upcoming change, maybe the warning could include a bit more information on how to do so? I suppose that most developers that are going to run into it will ask the same question. I'll gladly submit a PR to improve it if I get some guidance on what would need to be changed
- if the warning is necessary, could it be displayed less often? because it is outputted dozens of times on some applications where I tested the RC

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-1bky4j?file=repro/src/app

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.0-rc.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.0-rc.0
@angular/cdk                    15.1.4
@schematics/angular             15.2.0-rc.0

```

Issues.Title: refactor(router): Remove warning for an invalid ActivatedRoute
Issues.Body:
This warning was put in place to surface an error when developers use an ActivatedRoute with an invalid structure in tests. However, there isn't a clear path to fixing it and the tests continue to pass (ideally - that's what the recovery code is there for). Rather than surfacing an error that developers would be confused by and likely ignore, it would be better to not warn at all unless there is a clearer action to take to resolve the issue.

resolves #49116
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(router): Remove warning for an invalid ActivatedRoute" (#49117)

Issues.Title: Typed Forms: Unable to use formBuilder.array() for a typed form array with empty initialization
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I'm unable to initialize a (pre) typed form with an empty form array, because the formArray type cannot be inferred with an empty initialization.

form type
```
interface EntryForm {
  title: FormControl<string>;
  entries: FormArray<
    FormGroup<{
      entryId: FormControl<string>;
    }>
  >;
}
```

not working (type error)
```
  formA = this.fb.nonNullable.group<EntryForm>({
    title: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
    entries: this.fb.nonNullable.array([]),
  });
```

working example
```
  formB = this.fb.nonNullable.group<EntryForm>({
    title: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
    entries: this.fb.nonNullable.array([
      this.fb.nonNullable.group({
        entryId: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
      }),
    ]),
  });
```

workaround - cast the form array to any
```
  formC = this.fb.nonNullable.group<EntryForm>({
    title: this.fb.nonNullable.control(''),
    entries: this.fb.nonNullable.array([]) as any,
  });
```

I provided a stackblitz example to showcase this issue.

Is this intentional or are there other ways to initialize an empty typed form array?

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pbt1ra?file=src/main.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
Type 'FormArray<FormControl<unknown>>' is not assignable to type 'FormArray<FormGroup<{ entryId: FormControl<string>; }>>'.
  Types of property 'controls' are incompatible.
    Type 'FormControl<unknown>[]' is not assignable to type 'FormGroup<{ entryId: FormControl<string>; }>[]'.
      Type 'FormControl<unknown>' is not assignable to type 'FormGroup<{ entryId: FormControl<string>; }>'
```

Issues.Title: While testing with Jest 29, zone.js prints an Unhandled Promise rejection using firstValueFrom
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

zone.js

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I use Jest for the app testing.

After updating Jest 28 to 29 I found this issue: 

I have this function on the app component: 

```
public async testFunction() {
    await firstValueFrom(of('').pipe(
      map(() => {
        throw 'error'
      })
    ))
  }
```

and I have this test on the spec file: 

```
it('should throw an error', async () => {
    const fixture = TestBed.createComponent(AppComponent);
    const app = fixture.componentInstance;
    try {
      await app.testFunction();
    } catch (e) {
      expect(true).toEqual(true);
    }
  });
```
Using Jest 28 it works perfect, but If I update to Jest 29 Zone.js prints a console.error like the promise was unhandled but as you can see on the test I handle the promise.

The test passes, but the console.error is annoying.

Please, read the anything else part to see my jest configuration. To compare between Jest versions you can execute: 

`npm uninstall jest jest-preset-angular @types/jest`
Jest 29 try: `npm install --save-dev jest jest-preset-angular@next @types/jest`
Jest 28 try: `npm install --save-dev jest jest-preset-angular @types/jest`

Thanks!




### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

[example-project](https://github.com/jordibaliellas/angular-jest-29)

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
console.error
    Unhandled Promise rejection: error ; Zone: ProxyZone ; Task: null ; Value: error undefined

      at Object.api.onUnhandledError (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1109:29)
      at handleUnhandledRejection (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1137:17)
      at _loop_2 (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1128:21)
      at Object.api.microtaskDrainDone (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:1132:17)
      at drainMicroTaskQueue (node_modules/zone.js/bundles/zone-testing-bundle.umd.js:639:22)
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

<details>
<summary>evanw/esbuild</summary>

### [`v0.17.9`](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​0179)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/compare/v0.17.8...v0.17.9)

-   Parse rest bindings in TypeScript types ([#​2937](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2937))

    Previously esbuild was unable to parse the following valid TypeScript code:

    ```ts
    let tuple: (...[e1, e2, ...es]: any) => any
    ```

    This release includes support for parsing code like this.

-   Fix TypeScript code translation for certain computed `declare` class fields ([#​2914](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2914))

    In TypeScript, the key of a computed `declare` class field should only be preserved if there are no decorators for that field. Previously esbuild always preserved the key, but esbuild will now remove the key to match the output of the TypeScript compiler:

    ```ts
    // Original code
    declare function dec(a: any, b: any): any
    declare const removeMe: unique symbol
    declare const keepMe: unique symbol
    class X {
        declare [removeMe]: any
        @​dec declare [keepMe]: any
    }

    // Old output
    var _a;
    class X {
    }
    removeMe, _a = keepMe;
    __decorateClass([
      dec
    ], X.prototype, _a, 2);

    // New output
    var _a;
    class X {
    }
    _a = keepMe;
    __decorateClass([
      dec
    ], X.prototype, _a, 2);
    ```

-   Fix a crash with path resolution error generation ([#​2913](https://togithub.com/evanw/esbuild/issues/2913))

    In certain situations, a module containing an invalid import path could previously cause esbuild to crash when it attempts to generate a more helpful error message. This crash has been fixed.

</details>

Issues.Title: Bloated webpack  cache in .angular folder
Issues.Body:
### Command

config

### Description

Please see your issue 22323 and the related prior issue.

Just wondering about more granular control of the cache.  All of a sudden the webpack files were default added into TFS and caused a simply resolved muck-up.  Being new to this, got with my higher ups to confirm we just exclude .angular from check in -- intuitively obvious but still -- they were default selected for check in.  So naturally, ask why :)

How can we more granularly control the size of this cache and know what to delete safely?  There is supposedly a tool for this but I can't find where to download it.  So this may be the answer we're looking for.  Issue 22323 mentions this, again, I'll be derned if I can find it.

Main point is -- just arbitrarily caching all these entries did have the above mentioned side effect.

### Describe the solution you'd like

More clearly publish the location of this maintenance tool mentioned in issue 22323.  That's the best start.  If it doesn't work or some ideas come up for improvement after this I'll mention them.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

None.

Issues.Title: `ng update @angular/cli` for custom builders
Issues.Body:
### Command

update

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Currently if I use custom builders (such as `@angular-builders/custom-webpack`) doing `ng update @angular/cli` skips some updates (for version 15 it doesn't update main karma file). This is due to migration step which checks if builder target is `@angular-devkit/build-angular:karma`. There should be a way to do migrations also for custom builders (which are using `@angular-devkit/build-angular` with webpack and index.html customizations under the hood).

At least i expect Angular migrations to work with community well known custom builders (such as `@angular-builders/custom-webpack` or `ngx-build-plus`), ideally it should work for any custom builders. Maybe migrations should not be checking only `@angular-devkit/build-angular` builders?

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Set `"builder": "@angular-builders/custom-webpack:karma",` for "test" architect in `angular.json` file
2. Run `ng update @angular/cli`

### Exception or Error

Main karma file is not updated, but it should be updated.

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 14.2.10
Node: 16.19.0
Package Manager: npm 8.19.3 
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 14.2.12
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker

Package                      Version
------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect    0.1402.10
@angular-devkit/core         14.2.10
@angular-devkit/schematics   14.2.10
@angular/cli                 14.2.10
@schematics/angular          14.2.10
rxjs                         7.5.7
typescript                   4.7.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Error: Terser failed for unknown reason if scripts file is empty
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

11.0.7

### Description

Hi, I have upgraded angular from `11.0.7` to `13.3.10` and now Terser plugin throws an error if I have `scripts` in my build config and they produce an empty Terser build. It happens **only** with `"aot": true`



### Minimal Reproduction

```
 "targets": {
    "build": {
      "executor": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser",
      "options": {
        .... 
        "aot": true,
        "scripts": [
          {
            "input": "apps/app/src/monitoring.js",
            "inject": false,
            "bundleName": "monitoring"
          }
        ]
      },
```

`monitoring.js` looks like this:
```
// some commented js code
```

Command to run
```
> nx run app:build
```


### Exception or Error

```text
✔ Browser application bundle generation complete.

Error: Optimization error [monitoring.js]: Error: Terser failed for unknown reason.
    at optimizeWithTerser (/Users/cakeinpanic/projects/app/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/webpack/plugins/javascript-optimizer-worker.js:137:15)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:95:5)
    at async default_1 (/Users/cakeinpanic/projects/app/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/webpack/plugins/javascript-optimizer-worker.js:29:26)
    at async /Users/cakeinpanic/projects/app/node_modules/piscina/dist/src/worker.js:141:26
```


### Your Environment

```text
"@angular/animations": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/cdk": "13.3.9",
    "@angular/common": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/compiler": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/core": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/forms": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "13.3.12",
    "@angular/router": "13.3.12",
    "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "13.3.10",
    "@angular/cli": "13.3.10",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "13.3.12",
```


### Anything else relevant?

1. If I change`monitoring.js`content to 🔽 all build well
```
console.log(333)
// some commented js code
```
2. If I remove `"aot": true`, all build well


I assume that the issue is that Terser produces an *empty file* and can't handle this
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Error: Terser failed for unknown reason if scripts file is empty" (#24736)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow empty scripts to be optimized
Issues.Body:
When using the internal JavaScript optimizer plugin for Webpack with an empty script file provided via the `scripts` option, the build would fail. This was because of a safety check that was checking whether the terser result was falsy. Since an empty string is considered falsy, the build considered the result to be an error. The safety check now will only trigger if the terser result is not a string value to avoid this case.

Fixes #24736
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow empty scripts to be optimized" (#24737)

Issues.Title: build: update output target to ES2020
Issues.Body: The minimum supported Node.js version is now v16.13. This version provides full support for ES2020 allowing the output code target to be increased. While Node.js v16.13 supports higher ECMAScript versions, a limitation of the bazel `ts_library` rule currently prevents increasing further at this time.

Issues.Title: build: avoid unnecessary re-evaluation of starlark code
Issues.Body:
The experimental allow tags propagation flag is a `BuildLanguage` option and causes all Starlark code to be re-invoked. This causes a slow-down when switching between bazel query/ bazel build because the option is not set for `bazel query`.

We fix it by applying the option to all commands, using `common`.

Issues.Title: bug(deps): probably @material should be a peerDependency?
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Sometimes `@material/*` packages are installed within `@angular/material/node_modules` and not in root `node_modules` which then leads to issue while building styles for example telling that `@material/button/button` is not found.

I tried to flatten dependencies with `npm ddp` but it didn't help.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Install `@angular/material`
2. Add `@use "@angular/material" as mat;` to some stylesheet


### Expected Behavior

`@material/*` packages should be installed in root `node_modules`

### Actual Behavior

`@material/*` packages are installed nested inside `node_modules/@angular/material/node_modules`

### Environment

- Angular: 15.1.5
- CDK/Material: 15.1.4
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
- Node: 18.13.0
- NPM: 8.19.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(deps): probably @material should be a peerDependency?" (#26651)

Issues.Title: bug(CLIPBOARD): copy not working in timeout
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I want to clear the copied content after a couple of seconds from users clipboard.
As I understand by #19883, resetting the clipboard is not working. That's why I use provided a workaround, and copy a single whitespace.

Unfortunately, it is not possible to overwrite the clipboard reliably with a setTimeout (it worked a few times, but in most cases is it not working).

```
copy(value: string, delay: number): void {
  this.clipboard.copy(value);

  this.timeout = setTimeout(() => {
    this.clipboard.copy(" ");
  }, 1000 * delay);
}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. ng add @angular/material
2. implement copy function to any component
3. call copy('any value', 10) in constructor


### Expected Behavior

It should copy my value to clipboard. After 10 seconds it should be overwritten by a whitespace.

### Actual Behavior

My value is successfully copied to the clipboard. But it will not be overwritten by my whitespace.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.1.5
- CDK/Material: 15.1.5
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(CLIPBOARD): copy not working in timeout" (#26648)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-tab-group): add stretchTabs to MatTabsConfig
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

The new Material component updates changed how tabs present when used. Tabs now stretch to fill the header.

For those of us who wish to preserve the old behaviour, adding the stretchTabs settings to MatTabsConfig will be incredibly helpful to let us set the behaviour universally instead of updating each and every instance.

Please see PR https://github.com/angular/components/pull/26644

### Use Case

This will allow developers to globally set `stretchTabs` to false for all instances of `mat-tab-group` in an application via providers.

Ex:

```typescript
providers: [
  {
    provide: MAT_TABS_CONFIG,
    useValue: {
      stretchTabs: false,
    },
  },
]
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(mat-tab-group): add stretchTabs to MatTabsConfig" (#26645)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-option): Add aria-selected="false" back when used with single-selection
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

When mat-option is used with single-selection, the unselected option does not have aira-selected="false" set. This violates WCAG Success Criteria: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (A) as [the aria-selected attribute is a required attribute for elements with role="option"](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Accessibility/ARIA/Attributes/aria-selected).

### Expected behavior
- When mat-option is not selected, set aria-selected="false"
- When mat-option is selected, set aria-selected="true"


### Use Case

_No response_

Issues.Title: docs-bug(CdkOverlay): Overlay scroll strategies do not work unless main body is the scroll
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

The documentation for CdkOverlay doesn't mention the ScrollStrategies only work if the `window` object is the one scrolling. As explained in this bug report: #6157 in order to make it work for other scrollable elements, one needs to use the `cdk-scrollable` attribute, but this is not mentioned in the documentation.

Could you add an explanation of it there?

Also, I notice even setting `cdk-scrollable` doesn't make the `block` strategy work with non-window scrolls. So I think even more documentation is missing about how to make all this work.


### Affected documentation page

https://material.angular.io/cdk/overlay/api
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(CdkOverlay): Overlay scroll strategies do not work unless main body is the scroll" (#26641)

Issues.Title: bug(cdkDrag): strange behavior of cdkDropList elements while we changed their state
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

1. It is not clear how to track the situation when we want to update an element before interacting with dnd

e.g. we may have collapsible panels and we would like to collapse all panels (and the target) before starting the interaction; 

maybe you have some solutions on this? 

2. There is a strange situation if we try to change the state of such panels already on the dragStart event => the panels are collapsed but the dnd logic breaks placeholder appears in unexpected places

[example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-csru2j?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexpansion-overview-example.ts)

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. change state of drag elements during drag start


### Expected Behavior

1. it would be great to have some approach for interacting with dnd elements before directly starting dnd
2. even if the state of the items changes during drag -> this does not break the logic

### Actual Behavior

1. there is no default approach to change state before drag start
2. dnd behaves strangely if the internal state of the elements changes

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.1
- CDK/Material: 15.0.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System: macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdkDrag): strange behavior of cdkDropList elements while we changed their state" (#26640)

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Accordion): Accordion provider
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

In many cases in Angular Material to communicate with parent component is used a parent provider with injection token and there is a comment that says:

(For example into the accordion)
```
/**
* Injection token that can be used to reference instances of `CdkAccordion`. It serves
* as alternative token to the actual `CdkAccordion` class which could cause unnecessary
* retention of the class and its directive metadata.
*/
export const CDK_ACCORDION = new InjectionToken<CdkAccordion>('CdkAccordion');
```

And in the child component it's needed to use like this:
`constructor(@Inject(ACCORDION) accordion: AccordionComponent){}`

What mean this and why it's not enough only use into the child component the reference of the parent component like this:

`constructor(public cdkAccordion: CdkAccordion){}`

Thanks

### Affected documentation page

accordion

Issues.Title: bug(mat-table): Non scoped style customizations behave differently from Scoped style customizations (css precedence conflict)
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was Angular / Material 14 ### Description There is a CSS precedence conflict for mat-table where the height of mat-row is not set to 52px (as per spec) **unless** [scoped sass styles](https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#scoping-style-customizations) are used. This appears to be only in the 'flex' mat-table approach and not when using a native ``. ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce: - Create a mat-table without scoped CSS styles => row height is not 52px - Must use the 'flex' table approach and not native tables with directives ### Expected Behavior See this line from the [v15 migration docs](https://stackblitz.com/run?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-flex-basic-example.ts) under the `Table` component: Row height is 52px instead of 48px. That is the desired behavior for a table row per spec. ### Actual Behavior #### Example from Angular docs (no scoped styles) If you look at this stackblitz example from the docs [Basic use of `` (uses display flex)](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples#table-basic) you will see an example which does not use [Scoped style customizations](https://material.angular.io/guide/theming#scoping-style-customizations). That particular example defines the mat styling (no wrapping selector) like this: @include mat.all-component-themes($theme); This mixin does indeed generate a `height:52px` selector as per spec, but it is overridden by a higher precedence selector - resulting in `height: unset`. The rows just end up at their 'natural' height. You can see that in this devtools screenshot. The higher precedence style appears to be coming from the [embedded scss styles in the Angular matTable component itself.](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/main/src/material/table/table.scss) #### Forked version with scoped styles Next I tried creating a [fork with scoped styles](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ohqraz-kxbm3v?file=src%2Ftheme.scss,src%2Findex.html) for the stackblitz page (which is how my own application is configured). .my-styles { @include mat.all-component-themes($theme); } Now the scoped selector has a higher precedence resulting in a row height of 52px as per spec. So **without** scoped styles (as in the example stackblitz) the behavior is not to spec. #### Another mat-table example in the docs Another example on the same page [Flex table where one column's cells has a greater height than others](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples#table-flex-large-row) suggests using the following css to set the height of a column (the 'name' column). ``` .mat-column-name { height: 100px; } ``` That works in the stackblitz, but as soon as you add scoped styles it fails spectacularly because the cells are of height 100px and the containing row is of height 52px! ### Summary For my own needs I actually **want** the unset behavior, with perhaps a min-height because my rows need to grow with their content. I can figure out a workaround for now. I wanted to raise this since I can't find any other issues mentioning it and the current examples are not to spec since they don't use scoped styles. Note: I've only observed this with mat-table-row heights (I only updated to v15 yesterday), but it is potentially a wider issue. ### Environment - Angular: 15.0.0 / 15.1.4 - CDK/Material: 15.1.4 - Browser(s): Any - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Any
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-table): Non scoped style customizations behave differently from Scoped style customizations (css precedence conflict)" (#26628)

Issues.Title: Bug: Datepicker outside visible area when opened in dialog
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When the mat-datepicker is opened in a component shown with the MatDialogRef on a small screen, the calendar picker is shown outside the visible area.

### Reproduction

1. Create a component that contains mat-datepicker
2. Open that component with the MatDialogRef
3. Reduce the screen size to something around iPad size
4. Click on the calendar icon of the mat-datepicker to open the date selection
5. See that dialog is outside of the visible area

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-mvkv5q

### Expected Behavior

The calendar-dialog can still be operated and all dates and actions are visible or accessible throw scroll.

### Actual Behavior

The calendar-dialog is outside of the visible area

### Environment

OS: Windows 10
Browser Chrome
Version 109.0.5414.122
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Bug: Datepicker outside visible area when opened in dialog" (#26626)
